    createDeckMap(ClientModel clientModel)
     
    private void
    createSchoolBoardsMap(ClientModel clientModel)
     
    private void
    drawAllSchoolBoardsTowers(ClientModel clientModel)
    This method draws the correct number of tower on schoolBoards, for each player
    private void
    drawIslands(ClientModel clientModel)
    This method draws the entire island block It is very complex, so uses a lot of helper methods Are used 2 grid panes, to dispose islands on two lines (superior line and inferior line) islandGrids[0] identifies the superior line islandGrids[1] identifies the inferior line Every grid's box contains and anchor pane, which contains an HBox In every HBox there is a number of ImageViews equals to the number of merged islands in that position The number of islands in superior and inferior line is decided dividing by 2 the islands arrayList dimension: The floor will be the superior grid size The selling will be the inferior grid size When we pass the mouse on and island's HBox, user can see a new pane with island's information
    private void
    drawMotherNatureOnIsland(ClientModel clientModel, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, javafx.scene.layout.HBox box, int i)
    This method draws mother nature on the correct island
    private void
    drawProfessors(List<javafx.scene.Node> professorsOnSchoolBoard, String username, ClientModel clientModel)
    This method draws professors on correct schoolBoards for each professor is given the username of the possessor, so if username is equals to the possessor of that professor, the associated image view is set visible
    private javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    drawSingleIsland(Island island, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, ClientModel clientModel)
    This method physically draws the island: creates the HBox, adds image views in that, and then adds the HBox as anchor pane's child
    private void
    drawStudentsOnDiningRoom(List<javafx.scene.Node> studentsOnDiningRoom, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
    This method draws the students on the correct dining room For each color, the user can have a max of 10 students in his dining room First 10 children are image views which represents green students, then reds and so on
    private void
    drawStudentsOnEntrance(List<javafx.scene.Node> studentsOnEntrance, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
    This method draws students on the correct entrance In the enum of Color, for each color we know the path of the associate image, can be taken easily
    private void
    drawTowersOnIsland(Island island, double x, double y, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, ClientModel clientModel)
    This method draws towers on an island or an islands group
    private void
    drawTowersOnSchoolBoard(List<javafx.scene.Node> towersOnSchoolBoard, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
    This method draws the correct number of towers on the schoolBoard Towers are colorized circles, which are normally not visible and are made visible if are present in schoolBoard
    private void
    handleMouseEntranceAndExit(int i, javafx.scene.layout.HBox box, List<javafx.scene.Node> islands, ClientModel clientModel, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, double y)
    This method prepares everything to listen for mouseEvents on islands onMouseEntered -> is shown island's information onMouseExited -> is shown island's information It uses 3 helper methods, that are defined under this

  • Method Details

    • drawStudentsOnDiningRoom

      private void drawStudentsOnDiningRoom(List<javafx.scene.Node> studentsOnDiningRoom, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
      This method draws the students on the correct dining room For each color, the user can have a max of 10 students in his dining room First 10 children are image views which represents green students, then reds and so on
      Parameters:
      studentsOnDiningRoom - is an array of int, which contains, for each color, the number of students on dining room
      schoolBoard - schoolBoard

    • drawStudentsOnEntrance

      private void drawStudentsOnEntrance(List<javafx.scene.Node> studentsOnEntrance, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
      This method draws students on the correct entrance In the enum of Color, for each color we know the path of the associate image, can be taken easily
      Parameters:
      studentsOnEntrance - studentsOnEntrance
      schoolBoard - schoolBoard

    • drawTowersOnSchoolBoard

      private void drawTowersOnSchoolBoard(List<javafx.scene.Node> towersOnSchoolBoard, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
      This method draws the correct number of towers on the schoolBoard Towers are colorized circles, which are normally not visible and are made visible if are present in schoolBoard
      Parameters:
      towersOnSchoolBoard - towersOnSchoolBoard
      schoolBoard - schoolBoard

    • drawProfessors

      private void drawProfessors(List<javafx.scene.Node> professorsOnSchoolBoard, String username, ClientModel clientModel)
      This method draws professors on correct schoolBoards for each professor is given the username of the possessor, so if username is equals to the possessor of that professor, the associated image view is set visible
      Parameters:
      professorsOnSchoolBoard - professorsOnSchoolBoard
      username - username
      clientModel - clientModel

    • drawAllSchoolBoardsTowers

      private void drawAllSchoolBoardsTowers(ClientModel clientModel)
      This method draws the correct number of tower on schoolBoards, for each player
      Parameters:
      clientModel - clientModel

    • drawIslands

      private void drawIslands(ClientModel clientModel)
      This method draws the entire island block It is very complex, so uses a lot of helper methods Are used 2 grid panes, to dispose islands on two lines (superior line and inferior line) islandGrids[0] identifies the superior line islandGrids[1] identifies the inferior line Every grid's box contains and anchor pane, which contains an HBox In every HBox there is a number of ImageViews equals to the number of merged islands in that position The number of islands in superior and inferior line is decided dividing by 2 the islands arrayList dimension: The floor will be the superior grid size The selling will be the inferior grid size When we pass the mouse on and island's HBox, user can see a new pane with island's information
      Parameters:
      clientModel - clientModel

    • setupIslandGrid

      private void setupIslandGrid(ClientModel clientModel, int[] dimensions, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane[] islandGrids, List<List<javafx.scene.Node>> nodeList)
      Parameters:
      clientModel - clientModel
      dimensions - array that contains the size of superior and inferior grid
      islandGrids - islandGrids
      nodeList - array of lists that will contain, for each list, anchorPanes associated to islands

    • drawSingleIsland

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox drawSingleIsland(Island island, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, ClientModel clientModel)
      This method physically draws the island: creates the HBox, adds image views in that, and then adds the HBox as anchor pane's child
      Parameters:
      island - island to draw
      anchorPane - anchor pane where island has to be drawn
      clientModel - clientModel
      Returns:
      HBox where island is drawn

    • drawTowersOnIsland

      private void drawTowersOnIsland(Island island, double x, double y, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, ClientModel clientModel)
      This method draws towers on an island or an islands group
      Parameters:
      island - island
      x - x coordinate where draw the tower
      y - y coordinate where draw the tower
      anchorPane - anchor pane
      clientModel - client model

    • drawMotherNatureOnIsland

      private void drawMotherNatureOnIsland(ClientModel clientModel, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, javafx.scene.layout.HBox box, int i)
      This method draws mother nature on the correct island
      Parameters:
      clientModel - clientModel
      anchorPane - anchor pane
      box - HBox
      i - index of island, we have to draw mother nature only if he is on that island

    • setupNodeList

      private void setupNodeList(int i, int[] dimensions, List<List<javafx.scene.Node>> nodeList, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane)
      This method chooses if and Island is drawn in superior grid or inferior grid
      Parameters:
      i - index of island
      dimensions - dimensions
      nodeList - nodeList
      anchorPane - anchor pane

    • startListenForMouseEvent

      private void startListenForMouseEvent(int i, int[] dimensions, ClientModel clientModel, javafx.scene.layout.HBox box, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, List<javafx.scene.Node> islands)
      This method permits starts listen for mouseEvent on HBox panes
      Parameters:
      i - island index
      dimensions - dimensions
      clientModel - clientModel
      box - HBox
      anchorPane - anchor pane
      islands - all the islandPane's children

    • addIslandsAsChildren

      private void addIslandsAsChildren(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane[] islandGrids, List<List<javafx.scene.Node>> nodeList, List<javafx.scene.Node> islands)
      This method physically adds drawn islands with all the structure to the island Pane
      Parameters:
      islandGrids - islandGrids
      nodeList - nodeList
      islands - islands

    • handleMouseEntranceAndExit

      private void handleMouseEntranceAndExit(int i, javafx.scene.layout.HBox box, List<javafx.scene.Node> islands, ClientModel clientModel, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorPane, double y)
      This method prepares everything to listen for mouseEvents on islands onMouseEntered -> is shown island's information onMouseExited -> is shown island's information It uses 3 helper methods, that are defined under this
      Parameters:
      i - island index
      box - HBox
      islands - all island pane's children
      clientModel - clientModel
      anchorPane - anchorPane
      y - y coordinate of form that should be shown
